title: Fernando Pinto awarded “Gestor de Excelência” prizeTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Fernando Pinto awarded “Gestor de Excelência” prize Published on : Friday, October 16, 2015
The CEO of TAP, Fernando Pinto, was honoured at this year’s SVN – Business Travel Fair, where he was given the “Gestor de Excelência” (Top Manager) award, in recognition of his work at the helm of the Portuguese airline.
As Frédéric Frère, CEO of the Travelstore group pointed out while the award was being presented, Fernando Pinto “has been running TAP since October 2000, and it has been under his command that our carrier has shown most growth by becoming the world’s leading airline for routes between Europe and Brazil”.
As he thanked those present for their recognition, Fernando Pinto stressed “the importance of the contribution of the entire TAP team, for making the company evolve and grow in recent years”.
SVN 2015 is Portugal’s largest networking event in the business travel and tourism area. It was officially opened at Lisbon’s Myriad Crystal Center by the Secretary of State for Tourism, Adolfo Mesquita Nunes, on 13 October.
This event was also the stage for the presentation of the «Business Travel Barometer», a study carried out among Portuguese companies which reveals the trends influencing this kind of travel in the country.
Over the day, 21 speakers shared their success stories of Portuguese start-ups and companies that have grown by implementing internationalisation models, and thus contributing towards the prestige of our country’s entrepreneurial image.
Besides the ceremony honouring Fernando Pinto, this edition of SVN counted on the presence of entrepreneurs, business owners and managers such as Tim Vieira (Brave Generation), Rui Dias Ferreira (Vortal), Álvaro Covões (Everything is New), Tiago Forjaz (Mightworld), Filipa Neto (Chic by Choice), Francisco Melo Breyner (Zmar), Tiago Tubal (Eco Tuk Tours), Rita Marques (Impactrip), Mariana Cardoso (Lazy Flavors), Rodrigo Moreira Rato (Meshapp), Pedro Perreira (Uniplaces), Abdellatif Achachi (Morocco Tourist Office), Fávio Leoni (Accor), Ana Torres (World of Discoveries), Rui Bento (UBER Portugal), David Quito (Emirates), José Carlos Ferreira (Continental Airlines), Nuno Braga Lopes (Myriad) and Frédéric Frère (Travelstore American Express).
Under the theme «Go Portugal», the 8th SVN – Business Travel Fair aimed to show an innovative Portugal that is not averse to taking risks. Visitors were also able to engage with around 32 companies offering products and services from this business sector, at specially designated meeting points.
The «Business Travel Awards» were given during the event to those companies and managers who, during 2014, had excelled in the business travel sector in seven different categories.
Source:- TAP Portugal
